clauses.text: Either party may terminate for convenience with thirty (30) days’ written notice.
Customer shall pay $3,000 per month. Fees are fixed for the initial term and any renewal terms.
Provider guarantees 99.9% uptime measured monthly. Service credits apply for downtime exceeding the SLA.
Each party’s liability is capped at two (2) times fees paid in the prior twelve (12) months.
Any changes to this Agreement must be mutually agreed in writing.

risks.Termination convenience: Either party may terminate for convenience with thirty (30) days’ written notice.
risks.Fixed fees: Fees are fixed for the initial term and any renewal terms.
risks.SLA credits: Service credits apply for downtime exceeding the SLA.
risks.Liability cap 2x: Each party’s liability is capped at two (2) times fees paid in the prior twelve (12) months.
risks.Mutual amendments: Any changes to this Agreement must be mutually agreed in writing.

risk_items.evidence: Either party may terminate for convenience with thirty (30) days’ written notice.
Customer shall pay $3,000 per month. Fees are fixed for the initial term and any renewal terms.
Provider guarantees 99.9% uptime measured monthly. Service credits apply for downtime exceeding the SLA.
Each party’s liability is capped at two (2) times fees paid in the prior twelve (12) months.
Any changes to this Agreement must be mutually agreed in writing.

summary: Balanced termination + fixed pricing + SLA credits + reasonable liability cap + mutual amendments

clauses.text: Customer pays $5,000 per month. All fees are non-refundable.
Provider may change features at any time with thirty (30) days’ notice.
Provider’s liability is capped at fees paid in the prior three (3) months.

risks.Unilateral feature changes: Provider may change features at any time with thirty (30) days’ notice.
risks.3-month cap: Provider’s liability is capped at fees paid in the prior three (3) months.

risk_items.evidence: Customer pays $5,000 per month. All fees are non-refundable.
Provider may change features at any time with thirty (30) days’ notice.
Provider’s liability is capped at fees paid in the prior three (3) months.

summary: Non-refundable fees + unilateral changes + short liability cap → negotiate refunds, change controls, and cap

clauses.text: Provider’s total liability shall not exceed one hundred dollars ($100).
Provider may modify these terms at any time by posting updates, effective immediately.
All fees are non-refundable under any circumstances.
Disputes must be resolved by arbitration in Provider’s home state.

risks.$100 cap: Provider’s total liability shall not exceed $100.
risks.Immediate unilateral amendments: Provider may modify terms at any time, effective immediately.
risks.No refunds: All fees are non-refundable under any circumstances.

risk_items.evidence: Provider’s total liability shall not exceed one hundred dollars ($100).
Provider may modify these terms at any time by posting updates, effective immediately.
All fees are non-refundable under any circumstances.
Disputes must be resolved by arbitration in Provider’s home state.

summary: Hard stop: $100 cap + unilateral amendments. Reject unless amended materially

clauses.text: Provider may use Customer Data in aggregated and anonymized form for analytics and benchmarking.
Confidentiality obligations survive for one (1) year after termination.
Provider will maintain reasonable administrative, physical, and technical safeguards.

risks.Analytics use: Provider may use Customer Data in aggregated and anonymized form for analytics and benchmarking.

risk_items.evidence: Provider may use Customer Data in aggregated and anonymized form for analytics and benchmarking.
Confidentiality obligations survive for one (1) year after termination.
Provider will maintain reasonable administrative, physical, and technical safeguards.

summary: Benign data terms with anonymization + basic security and confidentiality

clauses.text: Service is provided on a best-efforts basis with no uptime commitments and no service credits.
Customer pays $1,200 per month.

risk_items.evidence: Service is provided on a best-efforts basis with no uptime commitments and no service credits.
Customer pays $1,200 per month.

summary: Operational risk: no SLA / no credits → negotiate uptime targets and remedies

clauses.text: All feedback, suggestions, and derivative works created using the Service shall be owned exclusively by Provider.
Provider may suspend or terminate access immediately for any suspected misuse.

risks.Immediate termination: Provider may terminate immediately for suspected misuse.

risk_items.evidence: All feedback, suggestions, and derivative works created using the Service shall be owned exclusively by Provider.
Provider may suspend or terminate access immediately for any suspected misuse.

summary: Hard stop: immediate termination on suspicion. Amend to objective standard + cure; renegotiate IP ownership of derivatives

clauses.text: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of Customer’s state. Venue shall be exclusive to Customer’s county courts.
Fees are refundable pro-rata if terminated early.
Provider may not change terms without Customer’s written consent.

risk_items.evidence: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of Customer’s state. Venue shall be exclusive to Customer’s county courts.
Fees are refundable pro-rata if terminated early.
Provider may not change terms without Customer’s written consent.

summary: Customer-friendly venue + refunds + mutual changes → low risk overall
